00064 namespace phys
00065 {
00066     class ActorContainerBase;
00067     namespace internal
00068     {
00069         class PhysMotionState;
00070     }
00071     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00072     /// @class ActorBase
00073     /// @headerfile actorbase.h
00074     /// @brief This is the base class from which all the actors inherit.
00075     /// @details The actor classes store and manage all the relevant data regarding
00076     /// objects inside the World.  They serve as a binder between the physics and
00077     /// graphics for objects and have functions that allow the manipulation of objects
00078     /// loaded into the World.  Currently there are 5 actor classes: ActorBase,
00079     /// ActorRigid, ActorSoft, ActorTerrain, ActorRagDoll. @n
00080     /// ActorBase is a base class that serves as a template for the other four actor classes. @n
00081     /// ActorBase should never be created, as it lacks the functionality needed for most objects.
00082     ///////////////////////////////////////
00083     class ActorBase {
00084         private:
00085             friend class World;
00086             friend class ActorContainerBase;
00087             friend class PhysicsManager;
00088 
00089         public:
00090             /// @enum ActorTypeName
00091             /// @brief A listing of Actor TypeNames
00092             /// @details These will be returned by ActorBase::GetType(), and will allow
00093             /// code using this to determine what type of Actor class they are working with
00094             /// and use this information to more safely cast to the correct Actor if needed.
00095             enum ActorTypeName
00096             {
00097                 Actorbase,
00098                 Actorragdoll,
00099                 Actorrigid,
00100                 Actorsoft,
00101                 Actorterrain
00102             };
00103 
00104         protected:
00105             /// @brief A pointer to the World the actor will reside.
00106             World* GameWorld;
00107 
00108             //abstraction for other libraries
00109             ///@brief This class encapsulates the functionality of the Ogre::Entity using this
00110             Ogre::Entity* entity;
00111 
00112             ///@brief This class encapsulates the functionality of the Ogre::SceneNode using this
00113             Ogre::SceneNode* node;
00114 
00115             ///@brief This class encapsulates the functionality of the Ogre::AnimationState using this
00116             Ogre::AnimationState* Animation;
00117 
00118             ///@brief This class encapsulates the functionality of the btCollisionShape using this
00119             btCollisionShape* Shape;
00120 
00121             ///@brief This class encapsulates the functionality of the btCollisionObject using this
00122             btCollisionObject* CollisionObject;
00123 
00124             ///@brief This class encapsulates the functionality of the PhysMotionState using this
00125             internal::PhysMotionState* MotionState;
00126 
00127             /// @brief This variable stores the type of actor that this class is.
00128             ActorTypeName ActorType;
00129 
00130             /// @brief Stores whether or not the current physics shape has been saved in the manager.
00131             bool ShapeIsSaved;
00132 
00133             /// @brief Creates a trimesh shape from the mesh file.
00134             /// @details Makes a trimesh to be used as a collision shape in the physics world from a mesh file. @n
00135             /// This is automaticly called by the CreateShapeFromMesh function in child classes and shouldn't be called manually.
00136             btTriangleMesh* CreateTrimesh() const;
00137 
00138 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00139 // Ogre Management Functions
00140 ///////////////////////////////////////
00141             /// @brief Creates an entity for the mesh file to be placed on a scene node.
00142             /// @details Creates an entity in the scene manager from the mesh file provided to be attached to a node in the graphical world. @n
00143             /// This function is called on by the Constructor, and shouldn't be called manually.
00144             /// @param name Name of the actor.
00145             /// @param file File name of the graphical mesh to be used.
00146             /// @param group Resource group where the graphical mesh can be found.
00147             void CreateEntity(String name, String file, String group);
00148 
00149             /// @brief Creates a node for the entity in the graphical world.
00150             /// @details Creates a node in the scene manager to attach the actor's entity to within the graphical world. @n
00151             /// This function is called on by the Constructor, and shouldn't be called manually.
00152             void CreateSceneNode();
00153 
00154             /// @brief Sets the location of the graphical body.
00155             /// @details This will take a Vector3 and set the location of the actor within the graphical world. @n
00156             /// This function is called on by the SetLocation function, and shouldn't be called manually.
00157             /// @param Place The Vector3 representing the location.
00158             void SetOgreLocation(Vector3 Place);
00159 
00160             /// @brief Retrieves the location of the graphical body.
00161             /// @details This function will retrieve the location of the object within the graphical world. This should always match the physics world.
00162             /// @return This returns a phys::Vector3 with the location of the graphics.
00163             Vector3 GetOgreLocation() const;
00164 
00165             /// @brief Sets the orientation of the graphical body.
00166             /// @details This will take a PhysQuaternion and set the orientation of the actor within the graphical world. @n
00167             /// This function is called on by the SetOrientation function, and shouldn't be called manually.
00168             /// @param Rotation The quaternion representing the rotation of the actor.
00169             void SetOgreOrientation (Quaternion Rotation);
00170 
00171             /// @brief Makes the actor visable.
00172             /// @details Adds the actor to all the nessessary graphics elements to make it visable on screen. @n
00173             /// This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds AddActor function and shouldn't ever need to be called manually.
00174             void AttachToGraphics();
00175 
00176             /// @brief Makes the actor invisable.
00177             /// @details This is the inverse of the AttachToGraphics function.  This will effectively remove the object from the graphics world and make it no longer visable. @n
00178             /// This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds RemoveActor function and shouldn't ever need to be called manually.
00179             void DetachFromGraphics();
00180 
00181 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00182 // Bullet Management
00183 ///////////////////////////////////////
00184             /// @brief Sets the location of the physics body.
00185             /// @details This will take a Vector3 and set the location of the actor within the physics world. @n
00186             /// This function is called on by the SetLocation function, and shouldn't be called manually.
00187             /// @param Location The Vector3 representing the location.
00188             virtual void SetBulletLocation (Vector3 Location);
00189 
00190             /// @brief Retrieves the location of the physics body.
00191             /// @details This function will retrieve the location of the object within the physics world.
00192             virtual Vector3 GetBulletLocation() const;
00193 
00194             /// @brief Sets the orientation of the physics body.
00195             /// @details This will take a PhysQuaternion and set the orientation of the actor within the physics world. @n
00196             /// This function is called on by the SetOrientation function, and shouldn't be called manually.
00197             /// @param Rotation The quaternion representing the rotation of the actor.
00198             virtual void SetBulletOrientation (Quaternion Rotation);
00199 
00200         public:
00201             ///@brief This is a collection of sounds for use with this actor.
00202             SoundSet* ActorSounds;
00203 
00204             /// @brief Gets the type of actor this class is.
00205             /// @details This function will get the type of class that you are working with for checking and casting.
00206             /// @return ActorTypeName The type of actor that this is.
00207             virtual int GetType();
00208 
00209             /// @brief Gets whether this actors current shape has been saved or not.
00210             /// @details This function will tell you if it's current physics shape has been saved for later use or not.
00211             /// @return Returns whether or not the shape of this actor has been saved.
00212             const bool GetShapeIsSaved();
00213 
00214             /// @brief Sets the basic parameters for more realistic collision behavior.
00215             /// @details This function will set the Friction and Resititution of the actor, which will enable it to collide
00216             /// and interact with other actors in a game world more realistically.
00217             /// @param Friction Should be self explanitory, higher values will resist sliding across surfaces.  This number is the
00218             /// coefficient of friction.  Range is from 0.0 to 2.0.  Behavior in this regard is determined by the friction of both
00219             /// colliding bodies.  @n Default: 0.5
00220             /// @param Restitution The coefficient of restitution determines how much energy is left after a collision with an object.
00221             /// Range is from 0.0 to 1.0.  Behavior in this regard is determined by the restitution of both colliding bodies.
00222             /// @n Default: 0.0
00223             void SetBasicCollisionParams(Real Friction, Real Restitution);
00224 
00225             /// @brief Sets the animation for this object.
00226             /// @details This function will get the specified animation for this object stored in the mesh file, and will loop the
00227             /// animation if specified.
00228             /// @param AnimationName Name of the stored animation to be loaded.
00229             /// @param Loop Whether or not you want the animation to loop.  For example, you would want an idle animation to loop,
00230             /// but not a death animation.
00231             void SetAnimation(String &AnimationName, bool Loop);
00232 
00233             /// @brief Enables the animation if one is set.
00234             /// @details This function will enable the animation if passed true, making the object animate.  If passed false will
00235             /// disable the animation.
00236             /// @param Enable True to enable the animation or false to disable the animation.
00237             void EnableAnimation(bool Enable);
00238 
00239             /// @brief Tells whether this actor is animated or not.
00240             /// @details This function will return true if the actor has an animation set and it is enabled.
00241             /// @return Returns true if an animation is set and enabled.
00242             bool IsAnimated();
00243 
00244             /// @brief Advances the animation, making it animate.
00245             /// @details You need to call this every frame while the actor is to be animated, otherwise even with the animation
00246             /// enabled you will see no change in the animation.
00247             void AdvanceAnimation(Real Time);
00248 
00249             /// @brief Unloads a loaded animation.
00250             /// @details This function will remove the existing set animation.
00251             void RemoveSetAnimation();
00252 
00253 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00254 // Creation, Destruction and Initialization
00255 ///////////////////////////////////////
00256 
00257             /// @brief Destructor.
00258             /// @details The class destructor.
00259             virtual ~ActorBase ();
00260 
00261             /// @brief Descriptive constructor.
00262             /// @details This constructor contains the basic information needed to make an actor.
00263             /// @param name The name of the actor.
00264             /// @param file The 3d mesh file that contains the 3d model the actor will use.
00265             /// @param group The resource group where the 3d mesh and other related files can be found.
00266             /// @param _World Pointer to the World this object will be added to.
00267             ActorBase (String name, String file, String group, World* _World);
00268 
00269             /// @brief Sets the starting location of the actor.
00270             /// @details Calling this function after adding it to the World will have no effect. @n
00271             /// This function will set where the actor will be located in the World when it is first placed inside the world.
00272             /// @param Location The Vector3 representing the location.
00273             void SetInitLocation(Vector3 Location);
00274 
00275             /// @brief Sets the starting orientation of the actor.
00276             /// @details Calling this function after adding it to the World will have no effect. @n
00277             /// This function will set where the actor is facing in the World when it is first placed inside the world.
00278             /// @param Orientation The PhysQuaternion representing the Orientation.
00279             void SetInitOrientation(Quaternion Orientation);
00280 
00281             /// @brief Manually sets the location of the actor.
00282             /// @details Calling this function prior to adding it to the World will have no effect. @n
00283             /// In most situations you won't want to use this function, and instead produce movement through physics functions.
00284             /// @param x Location on the X vector.
00285             /// @param y Location on the Y vector.
00286             /// @param z Location on the Z vector.
00287             void SetLocation(Real x, Real y, Real z);
00288 
00289             /// @brief Manually sets the location of the actor.
00290             /// @details Calling this function prior to adding it to the World will have no effect. @n
00291             /// In most situations you won't want to use this function, and instead produce movement through physics functions.
00292             /// @param Place The Vector3 representing the location.
00293             void SetLocation(Vector3 Place);
00294 
00295             /// @brief Retrieves the location of the object.
00296             /// @details This function will retrieve the location of the object within the world.
00297             Vector3 GetLocation() const;
00298 
00299             /// @brief Retrieves the name of the object.
00300             /// @details This function will retrieve the name of the object,
00301             std::string GetName() const;
00302 
00303             /// @brief Sets the orientation of the actor.
00304             /// @details Sets the orientation of the actor via Quaternion parameters.
00305             /// @param x Where the X vector is rotated about.
00306             /// @param y Where the Y vector is rotated about.
00307             /// @param z Where the Z vector is rotated about.
00308             /// @param w How much to about the x, y, z.
00309             void SetOrientation(Real x, Real y, Real z, Real w);
00310 
00311             /// @brief Sets the orientation of the actor.
00312             /// @details Sets the orientation of the actor via a Quaternion.
00313             /// @param Rotation The Quaternion representing the Rotation.
00314             void SetOrientation(Quaternion Rotation);
00315 
00316             /// @brief Sets the scale of the actor.
00317             /// @details This function will alter the scaling/size of the actor with the given vector3.
00318             /// @param scale The vector3 by which to apply the scale.  Will scale each axis' accordingly.
00319             void SetActorScaling(Vector3 scale);
00320 
00321             /// @brief Creates a collision shape from mesh file.
00322             /// @details This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to
00323             /// construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.  This shoiuld
00324             /// be used with only with Dynamic objects.
00325             /// @param accuracy A short unsigned int, the higher the more accurate, but the more resource intensive. This is Actor dependent
00326             virtual void CreateShapeFromMeshDynamic(short unsigned int accuracy ) = 0;
00327 
00328 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00329 // Working with the World
00330 ///////////////////////////////////////
00331             /// @brief Adds the actor to the physics world.
00332             /// @details Adds the actor to the physics world. @n
00333             /// This is automatically called by the phys::Actors::AddActor function and Doesn't neet to be called manually.
00334             /// @param TargetWorld Pointer to the World class.
00335             virtual void AddObjectToWorld(World* TargetWorld) = 0;
00336 
00337             /// @brief Removes the actor from the physics world.
00338             /// @details Removes the actor from the physics world. @n
00339             /// This is automatically called by the phys::Actors::AddActor function and Doesn't neet to be called manually.
00340             /// @param TargetWorld Pointer to the World class.
00341             virtual void RemoveObjectFromWorld(World* TargetWorld) = 0;
00342 
00343 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00344 // Public Collision flag functions
00345 ///////////////////////////////////////
00346             /// @brief Sets the state of the object to Kinematic.
00347             /// @details This function will set the object to a Kinematic Object. @n
00348             /// Kinematic Objects are like Static Objects but are also able to be moved directly by character controllers.
00349             void SetKinematic();
00350 
00351             /// @brief Sets the state of the object to Static.
00352             /// @details This function will set the object to a Static Object. @n
00353             /// Static Objects don't move or have any force applied to them, but are cabable of exerting force on other objects.
00354             void SetStatic();
00355 
00356             /// @brief Checks of the actor is static or kinematic.
00357             /// @details Checks of the actor is static or kinematic, returns true if it is either.
00358             /// @return Returns true if the actor is static or kinematic.
00359             bool IsStaticOrKinematic();
00360     };
